quizzes.question: Which property allows to change the style of the mouse cursor?
quizzes.textContent: [h1]Setting the Mouse Cursor Style[/h1] CSS allows you to set your desired cursor style when you mouse over an element. For example, you can change your cursor into a hand icon, help icon, and much more, rather than using the default pointer. In the example below, the mouse pointer is set to a help icon when we mouse over the span element: [code format="html"] Do you need help? [/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2644" width="100%"]

quizzes.question: What value of the cursor property displays a plus icon?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The cursor Property Values[/h1]

There are numerous other possible values for the [b]cursor [/b]property, such as:
[b]default [/b]- default cursor
[b]crosshair [/b]- cursor displays as crosshair
[b]pointer [/b]- cursor displays hand icon
The list of possible values is quite long. The image below demonstrates the various available styles: [img id="2983" width="100%"]

[h1]The default Value[/h1]

Usually, the appearance of the mouse cursor is altered to provide a more interesting experience for website visitors. However, choosing the wrong cursor style can be misleading, as well. 

For example, if the cursor value is set to [b]default[/b], users may not "see" the links. [img id="2646" width="100%"]
[note]Choose your mouse cursor styles carefully.[/note]
